art-is-a-collaborati-andre-gide.author: Andre Gide
art-is-a-collaborati-andre-gide.text: Art is a collaboration between God and the artist, and the less the artist does the better.

before-anything-else-alexander-graham-be.author: Alexander Graham Bell
before-anything-else-alexander-graham-be.text: Before anything else, preparation is the key to success.

every-man-dies-not-william-wallace.author: William Wallace
every-man-dies-not-william-wallace.text: Every man dies. Not every man really lives.

people-dont-notice-anton-chekhov.author: Anton Chekhov
people-dont-notice-anton-chekhov.text: People don't notice whether it's winter or summer when they're happy.

what-makes-the-deser-antoine-de-saint-ex.author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery
what-makes-the-deser-antoine-de-saint-ex.text: What makes the desert beautiful is that somewhere it hides a well.

there-is-a-differenc-simon-sinek.text: There is a difference between listening and waiting for your turn to speak.
there-is-a-differenc-simon-sinek.author: Simon Sinek

the-big-picture-does-simon-sinek.text: The big picture doesn't just come from distance; it also comes from time.
the-big-picture-does-simon-sinek.author: Simon Sinek

directions-are-instr-simon-sinek.text: Directions are instructions given to explain how. Direction is a vision offered to explain why.
directions-are-instr-simon-sinek.author: Simon Sinek

the-cost-of-leadersh-simon-sinek.text: The cost of leadership is self-interest.
the-cost-of-leadersh-simon-sinek.author: Simon Sinek

nike-doesnt-want-to-simon-sinek.text: Nike doesn't want to make products for everyone - they want to make products for champions.
nike-doesnt-want-to-simon-sinek.author: Simon Sinek

people-dont-buy-wha-simon-sinek.text: People don't buy what you do, they buy why you do it.
people-dont-buy-wha-simon-sinek.author: Simon Sinek

its-always-the-orga-simon-sinek.text: It's always the organizations that are resource constrained that come up with the good ideas to win.
its-always-the-orga-simon-sinek.author: Simon Sinek

i-find-when-youre-simon-sinek.text: I find, when you're an optimist, life has a funny way of looking after you.
i-find-when-youre-simon-sinek.author: Simon Sinek

great-leaders-state-simon-sinek.text: Great leaders state out loud what they intend to do and in doing so, they get things done.
great-leaders-state-simon-sinek.author: Simon Sinek

the-trick-to-balance-simon-sinek.text: The trick to balance is to not make sacrificing important things become the norm.
the-trick-to-balance-simon-sinek.author: Simon Sinek

every-one-of-us-has-simon-sinek.text: Every one of us has the capacity to lead.
every-one-of-us-has-simon-sinek.author: Simon Sinek

the-most-basic-human-simon-sinek.text: The most basic human desire is to feel like you belong. Fitting in is important.
the-most-basic-human-simon-sinek.author: Simon Sinek

the-only-thing-neces-edmund-burke.text: The only thing necessary for the triumph of evil is for good men to do nothing.
the-only-thing-neces-edmund-burke.author: Edmund Burke

we-must-develop-and-martin-luther-king-j.text: We must develop and maintain the capacity to forgive. He who is devoid of the power to forgive is devoid of the power to love. There is some good in the worst of us and some evil in the best of us. When we discover this, we are less prone to hate our enemies.
we-must-develop-and-martin-luther-king-j.author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

study-nature-love-n-frank-lloyd-wright.text: Study nature, love nature, stay close to nature. It will never fail you.
study-nature-love-n-frank-lloyd-wright.author: Frank Lloyd Wright

in-every-walk-with-n-john-muir.text: In every walk with nature one receives far more than he seeks.
in-every-walk-with-n-john-muir.author: John Muir

look-deep-into-natur-albert-einstein.text: Look deep into nature, and then you will understand everything better.
look-deep-into-natur-albert-einstein.author: Albert Einstein

if-you-cant-explain-albert-einstein.text: If you can't explain it simply, you don't understand it well enough.
if-you-cant-explain-albert-einstein.author: Albert Einstein

life-is-like-riding-albert-einstein.text: Life is like riding a bicycle. To keep your balance, you must keep moving.
life-is-like-riding-albert-einstein.author: Albert Einstein

i-have-no-special-ta-albert-einstein.text: I have no special talent. I am only passionately curious.
i-have-no-special-ta-albert-einstein.author: Albert Einstein

adopt-the-pace-of-na-ralph-waldo-emerson.text: Adopt the pace of nature: her secret is patience.
adopt-the-pace-of-na-ralph-waldo-emerson.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

it-is-one-of-the-ble-ralph-waldo-emerson.text: It is one of the blessings of old friends that you can afford to be stupid with them.
it-is-one-of-the-ble-ralph-waldo-emerson.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

do-not-go-where-the-ralph-waldo-emerson.text: Do not go where the path may lead, go instead where there is no path and leave a trail.
do-not-go-where-the-ralph-waldo-emerson.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

bad-times-have-a-sci-ralph-waldo-emerson.text: Bad times have a scientific value. These are occasions a good learner would not miss.
bad-times-have-a-sci-ralph-waldo-emerson.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

the-only-way-to-have-ralph-waldo-emerson.text: The only way to have a friend is to be one.
the-only-way-to-have-ralph-waldo-emerson.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

the-greatest-glory-i-ralph-waldo-emerson.text: The greatest glory in living lies not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall.
the-greatest-glory-i-ralph-waldo-emerson.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

people-do-not-seem-t-ralph-waldo-emerson.text: People do not seem to realize that their opinion of the world is also a confession of character.
people-do-not-seem-t-ralph-waldo-emerson.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

the-creation-of-a-th-ralph-waldo-emerson.text: The creation of a thousand forests is in one acorn.
the-creation-of-a-th-ralph-waldo-emerson.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

it-is-not-length-of-ralph-waldo-emerson.text: It is not length of life, but depth of life.
it-is-not-length-of-ralph-waldo-emerson.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

fear-defeats-more-pe-ralph-waldo-emerson.text: Fear defeats more people than any other one thing in the world.
fear-defeats-more-pe-ralph-waldo-emerson.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

a-great-man-is-alway-ralph-waldo-emerson.text: A great man is always willing to be little.
a-great-man-is-alway-ralph-waldo-emerson.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

an-ounce-of-action-i-ralph-waldo-emerson.text: An ounce of action is worth a ton of theory.
an-ounce-of-action-i-ralph-waldo-emerson.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

he-who-is-not-everyd-ralph-waldo-emerson.text: He who is not everyday conquering some fear has not learned the secret of life.
he-who-is-not-everyd-ralph-waldo-emerson.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

lifes-most-persiste-martin-luther-king-j.text: Life's most persistent and urgent question is, 'What are you doing for others?'
lifes-most-persiste-martin-luther-king-j.author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

advice-is-like-snow-samuel-taylor-coleri.author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge
advice-is-like-snow-samuel-taylor-coleri.text: Advice is like snow - the softer it falls, the longer it dwells upon, and the deeper it sinks into the mind.

every-failure-is-a-s-william-whewell.author: William Whewell
every-failure-is-a-s-william-whewell.text: Every failure is a step to success.

the-actions-of-men-a-james-joyce.author: James Joyce
the-actions-of-men-a-james-joyce.text: The actions of men are the best interpreters of their thoughts.

the-great-tragedy-of-thomas-huxley.author: Thomas Huxley
the-great-tragedy-of-thomas-huxley.text: The great tragedy of science - the slaying of a beautiful hypothesis by an ugly fact.

you-can-be-shattered-glennon-doyle-melto.author: Glennon Doyle Melton
you-can-be-shattered-glennon-doyle-melto.text: You can be shattered, and then you can put yourself back together piece by piece. But what can happen over time is this: You wake up one day and realize that you have put yourself back together completely differently. That you are whole, finally, and strong - but you are now a different shape, a different size.

genius-is-the-abilit-f-scott-fitzgerald.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
genius-is-the-abilit-f-scott-fitzgerald.text: Genius is the ability to put into effect what is on your mind.

love-is-a-better-tea-albert-einstein.author: Albert Einstein
love-is-a-better-tea-albert-einstein.text: Love is a better teacher than duty.

never-bend-your-head-helen-keller.author: Helen Keller
never-bend-your-head-helen-keller.text: Never bend your head. Always hold it high. Look the world straight in the eye.

the-roots-of-all-goo-dalai-lama.author: Dalai Lama
the-roots-of-all-goo-dalai-lama.text: The roots of all goodness lie in the soil of appreciation for goodness.

when-your-work-speak-henry-j-kaiser.author: Henry J. Kaiser
when-your-work-speak-henry-j-kaiser.text: When your work speaks for itself, don't interrupt.

art-washes-away-from-pablo-picasso.author: Pablo Picasso
art-washes-away-from-pablo-picasso.text: Art washes away from the soul the dust of everyday life.

isnt-it-strange-tha-charles-lindbergh.author: Charles Lindbergh
isnt-it-strange-tha-charles-lindbergh.text: Isn't it strange that we talk least about the things we think about most?

it-is-not-the-creati-margaret-thatcher.author: Margaret Thatcher
it-is-not-the-creati-margaret-thatcher.text: It is not the creation of wealth that is wrong, but the love of money for its own sake.

the-man-who-has-won-b-c-forbes.author: B. C. Forbes
the-man-who-has-won-b-c-forbes.text: The man who has won millions at the cost of his conscience is a failure.

this-suspense-is-ter-oscar-wilde.author: Oscar Wilde
this-suspense-is-ter-oscar-wilde.text: This suspense is terrible. I hope it will last.

a-fool-can-throw-a-s-saul-bellow.author: Saul Bellow
a-fool-can-throw-a-s-saul-bellow.text: A fool can throw a stone in a pond that 100 wise men can not get out.

an-artist-cannot-fai-charles-horton-cool.author: Charles Horton Cooley
an-artist-cannot-fai-charles-horton-cool.text: An artist cannot fail; it is a success to be one.

i-tell-young-people-hank-aaron.author: Hank Aaron
i-tell-young-people-hank-aaron.text: I tell young people - including my granddaughter - there is no shortcut in life. You have to take it one step at a time and work hard. And you have to give back.

it-doesnt-take-a-lo-j-c-watts.author: J. C. Watts
it-doesnt-take-a-lo-j-c-watts.text: It doesn't take a lot of strength to hang on. It takes a lot of strength to let go.

love-in-its-essence-lucius-annaeus-senec.author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca
love-in-its-essence-lucius-annaeus-senec.text: Love in its essence is spiritual fire.

there-are-years-that-zora-neale-hurston.author: Zora Neale Hurston
there-are-years-that-zora-neale-hurston.text: There are years that ask questions and years that answer.

we-cannot-despair-of-albert-einstein.author: Albert Einstein
we-cannot-despair-of-albert-einstein.text: We cannot despair of humanity, since we ourselves are human beings.

expect-problems-and-alfred-a-montapert.author: Alfred A. Montapert
expect-problems-and-alfred-a-montapert.text: Expect problems and eat them for breakfast.

to-truly-cherish-the-marie-kondo.author: Marie Kondo
to-truly-cherish-the-marie-kondo.text: To truly cherish the things that are important to you, you must first discard those that have outlived their purpose. And if you no longer need them, then that is neither wasteful nor shameful. Can you truthfully say that you treasure something buried so deeply in a cupboard or drawer that you have forgotten its existence?

we-are-all-born-mad-samuel-beckett.author: Samuel Beckett
we-are-all-born-mad-samuel-beckett.text: We are all born mad. Some remain so.

i-was-never-the-smar-jack-welch.author: Jack Welch
i-was-never-the-smar-jack-welch.text: I was never the smartest guy in the room. From the first person I hired, I was never the smartest guy in the room. And that's a big deal. And if you're going to be a leader - if you're a leader and you're the smartest guy in the world - in the room, you've got real problems.

curiosity-will-conqu-james-stephens.author: James Stephens
curiosity-will-conqu-james-stephens.text: Curiosity will conquer fear even more than bravery will.

the-sole-meaning-of-leo-tolstoy.author: Leo Tolstoy
the-sole-meaning-of-leo-tolstoy.text: The sole meaning of life is to serve humanity.

the-urge-to-save-hum-h-l-mencken.author: H. L. Mencken
the-urge-to-save-hum-h-l-mencken.text: The urge to save humanity is almost always a false front for the urge to rule.

everything-that-irri-carl-jung.author: Carl Jung
everything-that-irri-carl-jung.text: Everything that irritates us about others can lead us to an understanding of ourselves.

it-is-for-others-one-jules-verne.author: Jules Verne
it-is-for-others-one-jules-verne.text: It is for others one must learn to do everything; for there lies the secret of happiness.

nothing-is-as-obnoxi-f-scott-fitzgerald.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
nothing-is-as-obnoxi-f-scott-fitzgerald.text: Nothing is as obnoxious as other people's luck.

woe-to-the-man-whose-joseph-conrad.author: Joseph Conrad
woe-to-the-man-whose-joseph-conrad.text: Woe to the man whose heart has not learned while young to hope, to love - and to put its trust in life.

an-empty-canvas-is-a-wassily-kandinsky.author: Wassily Kandinsky
an-empty-canvas-is-a-wassily-kandinsky.text: An empty canvas is a living wonder... far lovelier than certain pictures.

be-faithful-to-that-andre-gide.author: Andre Gide
be-faithful-to-that-andre-gide.text: Be faithful to that which exists within yourself.

if-you-dont-like-th-dolly-parton.author: Dolly Parton
if-you-dont-like-th-dolly-parton.text: If you don't like the road you're walking, start paving another one.

life-lived-for-tomor-leo-buscaglia.author: Leo Buscaglia
life-lived-for-tomor-leo-buscaglia.text: Life lived for tomorrow will always be just a day away from being realized.

man-is-so-made-that-jean-de-la-fontaine.author: Jean de La Fontaine
man-is-so-made-that-jean-de-la-fontaine.text: Man is so made that when anything fires his soul, impossibilities vanish.

some-cause-happiness-oscar-wilde.author: Oscar Wilde
some-cause-happiness-oscar-wilde.text: Some cause happiness wherever they go; others whenever they go.

treasure-your-relati-anthony-j-d-angelo.author: Anthony J. D'Angelo
treasure-your-relati-anthony-j-d-angelo.text: Treasure your relationships, not your possessions.

what-is-art-but-a-wa-saul-bellow.author: Saul Bellow
what-is-art-but-a-wa-saul-bellow.text: What is art but a way of seeing?

art-consists-of-limi-gilbert-k-chesterto.author: Gilbert K. Chesterton
art-consists-of-limi-gilbert-k-chesterto.text: Art consists of limitation. The most beautiful part of every picture is the frame.

just-because-your-vo-edward-r-murrow.author: Edward R. Murrow
just-because-your-vo-edward-r-murrow.text: Just because your voice reaches halfway around the world doesn't mean you are wiser than when it reached only to the end of the bar.

if-you-have-only-one-maya-angelou.author: Maya Angelou
if-you-have-only-one-maya-angelou.text: If you have only one smile in you give it to the people you love.

if-you-wished-to-be-lucius-annaeus-senec.author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca
if-you-wished-to-be-lucius-annaeus-senec.text: If you wished to be loved, love.

the-only-way-to-disc-arthur-c-clarke.author: Arthur C. Clarke
the-only-way-to-disc-arthur-c-clarke.text: The only way to discover the limits of the possible is to go beyond them into the impossible.

there-is-no-instinct-lord-byron.author: Lord Byron
there-is-no-instinct-lord-byron.text: There is no instinct like that of the heart.

love-is-our-true-des-thomas-merton.author: Thomas Merton
love-is-our-true-des-thomas-merton.text: Love is our true destiny. We do not find the meaning of life by ourselves alone - we find it with another.

they-invented-hugs-t-bil-keane.author: Bil Keane
they-invented-hugs-t-bil-keane.text: They invented hugs to let people know you love them without saying anything.

we-are-most-alive-wh-john-updike.author: John Updike
we-are-most-alive-wh-john-updike.text: We are most alive when we're in love.

home-is-any-four-wal-helen-rowland.author: Helen Rowland
home-is-any-four-wal-helen-rowland.text: Home is any four walls that enclose the right person.

only-through-art-can-marcel-proust.author: Marcel Proust
only-through-art-can-marcel-proust.text: Only through art can we emerge from ourselves and know what another person sees.

whatever-our-souls-a-emily-bronte.author: Emily Bronte
whatever-our-souls-a-emily-bronte.text: Whatever our souls are made of, his and mine are the same.

a-man-is-but-the-pro-mahatma-gandhi.author: Mahatma Gandhi
a-man-is-but-the-pro-mahatma-gandhi.text: A man is but the product of his thoughts what he thinks, he becomes.

be-thine-own-palace-john-donne.author: John Donne
be-thine-own-palace-john-donne.text: Be thine own palace, or the world's thy jail.

blessed-are-the-youn-herbert-hoover.author: Herbert Hoover
blessed-are-the-youn-herbert-hoover.text: Blessed are the young for they shall inherit the national debt.

do-exactly-what-you-meister-eckhart.author: Meister Eckhart
do-exactly-what-you-meister-eckhart.text: Do exactly what you would do if you felt most secure.

i-am-a-kind-of-paran-j-d-salinger.author: J. D. Salinger
i-am-a-kind-of-paran-j-d-salinger.text: I am a kind of paranoid in reverse. I suspect people of plotting to make me happy.

i-feel-the-weight-of-jussie-smollett.author: Jussie Smollett
i-feel-the-weight-of-jussie-smollett.text: I feel the weight of just telling the truth. There really is no weight to telling the truth. It's a little scary sometimes, but if you tell the truth, you don't have to be looking over your shoulder.

i-want-to-be-thoroug-george-bernard-shaw.author: George Bernard Shaw
i-want-to-be-thoroug-george-bernard-shaw.text: I want to be thoroughly used up when I die, for the harder I work the more I live. I rejoice in life for its own sake.

its-always-too-earl-norman-vincent-peale.author: Norman Vincent Peale
its-always-too-earl-norman-vincent-peale.text: It's always too early to quit.

little-minds-are-tam-washington-irving.author: Washington Irving
little-minds-are-tam-washington-irving.text: Little minds are tamed and subdued by misfortune; but great minds rise above them.

one-fifth-of-the-peo-robert-kennedy.author: Robert Kennedy
one-fifth-of-the-peo-robert-kennedy.text: One-fifth of the people are against everything all the time.

one-word-frees-us-of-sophocles.author: Sophocles
one-word-frees-us-of-sophocles.text: One word frees us of all the weight and pain in life. That word is love.

the-man-who-can-keep-e-w-howe.author: E. W. Howe
the-man-who-can-keep-e-w-howe.text: The man who can keep a secret may be wise, but he is not half as wise as the man with no secrets to keep.

there-are-many-ways-franklin-d-roosevelt.author: Franklin D. Roosevelt
there-are-many-ways-franklin-d-roosevelt.text: There are many ways of going forward, but only one way of standing still.

there-is-a-thin-line-erma-bombeck.author: Erma Bombeck
there-is-a-thin-line-erma-bombeck.text: There is a thin line that separates laughter and pain, comedy and tragedy, humor and hurt.

time-is-the-school-i-delmore-schwartz.author: Delmore Schwartz
time-is-the-school-i-delmore-schwartz.text: Time is the school in which we learn, time is the fire in which we burn.

i-am-an-artist-i-emile-zola.author: Emile Zola
i-am-an-artist-i-emile-zola.text: I am an artist... I am here to live out loud.

nothing-is-more-sad-arthur-koestler.author: Arthur Koestler
nothing-is-more-sad-arthur-koestler.text: Nothing is more sad than the death of an illusion.

perhaps-one-of-the-m-calvin-coolidge.author: Calvin Coolidge
perhaps-one-of-the-m-calvin-coolidge.text: Perhaps one of the most important accomplishments of my administration has been minding my own business.

time-moves-in-one-di-william-gibson.author: William Gibson
time-moves-in-one-di-william-gibson.text: Time moves in one direction, memory in another.

everybody-knows-how-p-j-o-rourke.author: P. J. O'Rourke
everybody-knows-how-p-j-o-rourke.text: Everybody knows how to raise children, except the people who have them.

ideas-shape-the-cour-john-maynard-keynes.author: John Maynard Keynes
ideas-shape-the-cour-john-maynard-keynes.text: Ideas shape the course of history.

to-the-mind-that-is-lao-tzu.author: Lao Tzu
to-the-mind-that-is-lao-tzu.text: To the mind that is still, the whole universe surrenders.

first-love-is-only-a-george-bernard-shaw.author: George Bernard Shaw
first-love-is-only-a-george-bernard-shaw.text: First love is only a little foolishness and a lot of curiosity.

i-think-its-the-res-gianni-versace.author: Gianni Versace
i-think-its-the-res-gianni-versace.text: I think it's the responsibility of a designer to try to break rules and barriers.

in-matters-of-consci-mahatma-gandhi.author: Mahatma Gandhi
in-matters-of-consci-mahatma-gandhi.text: In matters of conscience, the law of the majority has no place.

little-progress-can-calvin-coolidge.author: Calvin Coolidge
little-progress-can-calvin-coolidge.text: Little progress can be made by merely attempting to repress what is evil. Our great hope lies in developing what is good.

love-takes-up-where-thomas-aquinas.author: Thomas Aquinas
love-takes-up-where-thomas-aquinas.text: Love takes up where knowledge leaves off.

the-time-you-enjoy-w-bertrand-russell.author: Bertrand Russell
the-time-you-enjoy-w-bertrand-russell.text: The time you enjoy wasting is not wasted time.

i-want-my-children-t-phyllis-diller.author: Phyllis Diller
i-want-my-children-t-phyllis-diller.text: I want my children to have all the things I couldn't afford. Then I want to move in with them.

if-you-cant-describ-w-edwards-deming.author: W. Edwards Deming
if-you-cant-describ-w-edwards-deming.text: If you can't describe what you are doing as a process, you don't know what you're doing.

light-is-the-task-wh-homer.author: Homer
light-is-the-task-wh-homer.text: Light is the task where many share the toil.

never-believe-anythi-otto-von-bismarck.author: Otto von Bismarck
never-believe-anythi-otto-von-bismarck.text: Never believe anything in politics until it has been officially denied.

the-eternal-quest-of-norman-cousins.author: Norman Cousins
the-eternal-quest-of-norman-cousins.text: The eternal quest of the individual human being is to shatter his loneliness.

the-world-of-reality-jean-jacques-rousse.author: Jean-Jacques Rousseau
the-world-of-reality-jean-jacques-rousse.text: The world of reality has its limits; the world of imagination is boundless.

a-cloudy-day-is-no-m-william-arthur-ward.author: William Arthur Ward
a-cloudy-day-is-no-m-william-arthur-ward.text: A cloudy day is no match for a sunny disposition.

if-two-wrongs-dont-laurence-j-peter.author: Laurence J. Peter
if-two-wrongs-dont-laurence-j-peter.text: If two wrongs don't make a right, try three.

one-forgives-to-the-francois-de-la-roche.author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld
one-forgives-to-the-francois-de-la-roche.text: One forgives to the degree that one loves.

they-are-ill-discove-francis-bacon.author: Francis Bacon
they-are-ill-discove-francis-bacon.text: They are ill discoverers that think there is no land, when they can see nothing but sea.

perfection-is-attain-voltaire.author: Voltaire
perfection-is-attain-voltaire.text: Perfection is attained by slow degrees; it requires the hand of time.

we-live-in-a-world-t-julia-butterfly-hil.author: Julia Butterfly Hill
we-live-in-a-world-t-julia-butterfly-hil.text: We live in a world that is full of problems, and we are the solutions to those problems.

you-can-never-plan-t-edmund-burke.author: Edmund Burke
you-can-never-plan-t-edmund-burke.text: You can never plan the future by the past.

in-the-end-we-will-martin-luther-king-jr.author: Martin Luther King, Jr.
in-the-end-we-will-martin-luther-king-jr.text: In the End, we will remember not the words of our enemies, but the silence of our friends.

every-picture-shows-alfred-sisley.author: Alfred Sisley
every-picture-shows-alfred-sisley.text: Every picture shows a spot with which the artist has fallen in love.

everythings-got-a-m-lewis-carroll.author: Lewis Carroll
everythings-got-a-m-lewis-carroll.text: Everything's got a moral, if only you can find it.

people-who-throw-kis-bob-hope.author: Bob Hope
people-who-throw-kis-bob-hope.text: People who throw kisses are hopelessly lazy.

dont-grieve-anythi-rumi.author: Rumi
dont-grieve-anythi-rumi.text: Don't grieve. Anything you lose comes round in another form.

everything-has-been-jean-paul-sartre.author: Jean-Paul Sartre
everything-has-been-jean-paul-sartre.text: Everything has been figured out, except how to live.

fatigue-makes-coward-vince-lombardi.author: Vince Lombardi
fatigue-makes-coward-vince-lombardi.text: Fatigue makes cowards of us all.

in-a-mad-world-only-akira-kurosawa.author: Akira Kurosawa
in-a-mad-world-only-akira-kurosawa.text: In a mad world, only the mad are sane.

sometimes-you-have-t-miles-davis.author: Miles Davis
sometimes-you-have-t-miles-davis.text: Sometimes you have to play a long time to be able to play like yourself.

the-whole-secret-of-horace-walpole.author: Horace Walpole
the-whole-secret-of-horace-walpole.text: The whole secret of life is to be interested in one thing profoundly and in a thousand things well.

there-are-those-who-george-galloway.author: George Galloway
there-are-those-who-george-galloway.text: There are those who wrap themselves in flags and blow the tinny trumpet of patriotism as a means of fooling the people.

we-waste-time-lookin-tom-robbins.author: Tom Robbins
we-waste-time-lookin-tom-robbins.text: We waste time looking for the perfect lover, instead of creating the perfect love.

build-up-your-weakne-knute-rockne.author: Knute Rockne
build-up-your-weakne-knute-rockne.text: Build up your weaknesses until they become your strong points.

it-is-easier-to-prev-benjamin-franklin.author: Benjamin Franklin
it-is-easier-to-prev-benjamin-franklin.text: It is easier to prevent bad habits than to break them.

a-man-paints-with-hi-michelangelo.author: Michelangelo
a-man-paints-with-hi-michelangelo.text: A man paints with his brains and not with his hands.

a-question-that-some-albert-einstein.author: Albert Einstein
a-question-that-some-albert-einstein.text: A question that sometimes drives me hazy: am I or are the others crazy?

as-a-matter-of-self-diogenes.author: Diogenes
as-a-matter-of-self-diogenes.text: As a matter of self-preservation, a man needs good friends or ardent enemies, for the former instruct him and the latter take him to task.

i-have-no-ambition-t-thomas-jefferson.author: Thomas Jefferson
i-have-no-ambition-t-thomas-jefferson.text: I have no ambition to govern men; it is a painful and thankless office.

ideologies-separate-eugene-ionesco.author: Eugene Ionesco
ideologies-separate-eugene-ionesco.text: Ideologies separate us. Dreams and anguish bring us together.

in-time-of-difficult-mao-zedong.author: Mao Zedong
in-time-of-difficult-mao-zedong.text: In time of difficulties, we must not lose sight of our achievements.

in-winter-i-plot-an-henry-rollins.author: Henry Rollins
in-winter-i-plot-an-henry-rollins.text: In winter, I plot and plan. In spring, I move.

it-was-one-of-those-charles-dickens.author: Charles Dickens
it-was-one-of-those-charles-dickens.text: It was one of those March days when the sun shines hot and the wind blows cold: when it is summer in the light, and winter in the shade.

scratch-a-pessimist-william-beveridge.author: William Beveridge
scratch-a-pessimist-william-beveridge.text: Scratch a pessimist and you find often a defender of privilege.

the-art-of-writing-i-gustave-flaubert.author: Gustave Flaubert
the-art-of-writing-i-gustave-flaubert.text: The art of writing is the art of discovering what you believe.

the-study-of-mathema-charles-caleb-colto.author: Charles Caleb Colton
the-study-of-mathema-charles-caleb-colto.text: The study of mathematics, like the Nile, begins in minuteness but ends in magnificence.

we-are-so-accustomed-francois-de-la-roch.author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld
we-are-so-accustomed-francois-de-la-roch.text: We are so accustomed to disguise ourselves to others that in the end we become disguised to ourselves.

hatred-does-not-ceas-buddha.author: Buddha
hatred-does-not-ceas-buddha.text: Hatred does not cease by hatred, but only by love; this is the eternal rule.

health-is-the-thing-franklin-pierce-adam.author: Franklin Pierce Adams
health-is-the-thing-franklin-pierce-adam.text: Health is the thing that makes you feel that now is the best time of the year.

life-isnt-a-matter-rose-kennedy.author: Rose Kennedy
life-isnt-a-matter-rose-kennedy.text: Life isn't a matter of milestones, but of moments.

take-time-for-all-th-benjamin-franklin.author: Benjamin Franklin
take-time-for-all-th-benjamin-franklin.text: Take time for all things: great haste makes great waste.

i-dont-try-to-descr-ray-bradbury.author: Ray Bradbury
i-dont-try-to-descr-ray-bradbury.text: I don't try to describe the future. I try to prevent it.

i-never-worry-about-shaquille-o-neal.author: Shaquille O'Neal
i-never-worry-about-shaquille-o-neal.text: I never worry about the problem. I worry about the solution.

life-is-10-percent-w-irving-berlin.author: Irving Berlin
life-is-10-percent-w-irving-berlin.text: Life is 10 percent what you make it, and 90 percent how you take it.

life-is-given-to-us-rabindranath-tagore.author: Rabindranath Tagore
life-is-given-to-us-rabindranath-tagore.text: Life is given to us, we earn it by giving it.

most-ignorance-is-vi-aldous-huxley.author: Aldous Huxley
most-ignorance-is-vi-aldous-huxley.text: Most ignorance is vincible ignorance. We don't know because we don't want to know.

slump-i-aint-in-no-yogi-berra.author: Yogi Berra
slump-i-aint-in-no-yogi-berra.text: Slump? I ain't in no slump... I just ain't hitting.

you-may-drive-out-na-horace.author: Horace
you-may-drive-out-na-horace.text: You may drive out nature with a pitchfork, yet she'll be constantly running back.

a-woman-is-like-a-te-eleanor-roosevelt.author: Eleanor Roosevelt
a-woman-is-like-a-te-eleanor-roosevelt.text: A woman is like a tea bag - you can't tell how strong she is until you put her in hot water.

dont-run-if-you-can-lou-holtz.author: Lou Holtz
dont-run-if-you-can-lou-holtz.text: Don't run if you can walk. Don't walk if you can stand. Don't stand if you can sit. Don't sit if you can lie down.

no-nation-can-rise-t-muhammad-ali-jinnah.author: Muhammad Ali Jinnah
no-nation-can-rise-t-muhammad-ali-jinnah.text: No nation can rise to the height of glory unless your women are side by side with you.

no-struggle-can-ever-muhammad-ali-jinnah.author: Muhammad Ali Jinnah
no-struggle-can-ever-muhammad-ali-jinnah.text: No struggle can ever succeed without women participating side by side with men.

poetry-fettered-fet-william-blake.author: William Blake
poetry-fettered-fet-william-blake.text: Poetry fettered, fetters the human race. Nations are destroyed or flourish in proportion as their poetry, painting, and music are destroyed or flourish.

the-more-i-think-abo-vincent-van-gogh.author: Vincent Van Gogh
the-more-i-think-abo-vincent-van-gogh.text: The more I think about it, the more I realize there is nothing more artistic than to love others.

tomorrow-is-only-fou-og-mandino.author: Og Mandino
tomorrow-is-only-fou-og-mandino.text: Tomorrow is only found in the calendar of fools.

what-is-art-it-is-t-rabindranath-tagore.author: Rabindranath Tagore
what-is-art-it-is-t-rabindranath-tagore.text: What is Art? It is the response of man's creative soul to the call of the Real.

what-is-called-geniu-henry-david-thoreau.author: Henry David Thoreau
what-is-called-geniu-henry-david-thoreau.text: What is called genius is the abundance of life and health.

a-charming-woman-loretta-young.author: Loretta Young
a-charming-woman-loretta-young.text: A charming woman... doesn't follow the crowd. She is herself.

at-eighteen-our-conv-f-scott-fitzgerald.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
at-eighteen-our-conv-f-scott-fitzgerald.text: At eighteen our convictions are hills from which we look; at forty-five they are caves in which we hide.

be-brave-young-love-oscar-hammerstein-ii.author: Oscar Hammerstein II
be-brave-young-love-oscar-hammerstein-ii.text: Be brave, young lovers, and follow your star.

by-working-faithfull-robert-frost.author: Robert Frost
by-working-faithfull-robert-frost.text: By working faithfully eight hours a day you may eventually get to be boss and work twelve hours a day.

courage-is-the-ladde-clare-boothe-luce.author: Clare Boothe Luce
courage-is-the-ladde-clare-boothe-luce.text: Courage is the ladder on which all the other virtues mount.

go-to-heaven-for-the-mark-twain.author: Mark Twain
go-to-heaven-for-the-mark-twain.text: Go to Heaven for the climate, Hell for the company.

he-who-desires-but-william-blake.author: William Blake
he-who-desires-but-william-blake.text: He who desires, but acts not, breeds pestilence.

i-was-taught-that-th-marie-curie.author: Marie Curie
i-was-taught-that-th-marie-curie.text: I was taught that the way of progress was neither swift nor easy.

in-my-beginning-is-m-t-s-eliot.author: T. S. Eliot
in-my-beginning-is-m-t-s-eliot.text: In my beginning is my end.

it-is-well-for-the-h-anatole-france.author: Anatole France
it-is-well-for-the-h-anatole-france.text: It is well for the heart to be naive and the mind not to be.

life-beats-down-and-stella-adler.author: Stella Adler
life-beats-down-and-stella-adler.text: Life beats down and crushes the soul and art reminds you that you have one.

my-religion-is-very-dalai-lama.author: Dalai Lama
my-religion-is-very-dalai-lama.text: My religion is very simple. My religion is kindness.

no-one-owns-life-bu-william-s-burroughs.author: William S. Burroughs
no-one-owns-life-bu-william-s-burroughs.text: No one owns life, but anyone who can pick up a frying pan owns death.

of-puns-it-has-been-edgar-allan-poe.author: Edgar Allan Poe
of-puns-it-has-been-edgar-allan-poe.text: Of puns it has been said that those who most dislike them are those who are least able to utter them.

one-who-deceives-wil-niccolo-machiavelli.author: Niccolo Machiavelli
one-who-deceives-wil-niccolo-machiavelli.text: One who deceives will always find those who allow themselves to be deceived.

the-better-i-get-to-charles-de-gaulle.author: Charles de Gaulle
the-better-i-get-to-charles-de-gaulle.text: The better I get to know men, the more I find myself loving dogs.

there-cannot-be-a-cr-henry-kissinger.author: Henry Kissinger
there-cannot-be-a-cr-henry-kissinger.text: There cannot be a crisis next week. My schedule is already full.

there-is-nothing-new-harry-s-truman.author: Harry S Truman
there-is-nothing-new-harry-s-truman.text: There is nothing new in the world except the history you do not know.

a-forest-bird-never-henrik-ibsen.author: Henrik Ibsen
a-forest-bird-never-henrik-ibsen.text: A forest bird never wants a cage.

an-intellectual-is-s-albert-camus.author: Albert Camus
an-intellectual-is-s-albert-camus.text: An intellectual is someone whose mind watches itself.

be-true-to-your-work-john-boyle-o-reilly.author: John Boyle O'Reilly
be-true-to-your-work-john-boyle-o-reilly.text: Be true to your work, your word, and your friend.

he-who-loves-with-pu-thomas-a-kempis.author: Thomas a Kempis
he-who-loves-with-pu-thomas-a-kempis.text: He who loves with purity considers not the gift of the lover, but the love of the giver.

i-am-going-to-try-to-anne-lamott.author: Anne Lamott
i-am-going-to-try-to-anne-lamott.text: I am going to try to pay attention to the spring. I am going to look around at all the flowers, and look up at the hectic trees. I am going to close my eyes and listen.

i-dont-believe-in-a-marcel-duchamp.author: Marcel Duchamp
i-dont-believe-in-a-marcel-duchamp.text: I don't believe in art. I believe in artists.

love-takes-off-masks-james-baldwin.author: James Baldwin
love-takes-off-masks-james-baldwin.text: Love takes off masks that we fear we cannot live without and know we cannot live within.

no-great-art-has-eve-rainer-maria-rilke.author: Rainer Maria Rilke
no-great-art-has-eve-rainer-maria-rilke.text: No great art has ever been made without the artist having known danger.

spring-is-when-you-f-doug-larson.author: Doug Larson
spring-is-when-you-f-doug-larson.text: Spring is when you feel like whistling even with a shoe full of slush.

the-true-art-of-memo-samuel-johnson.author: Samuel Johnson
the-true-art-of-memo-samuel-johnson.text: The true art of memory is the art of attention.

try-to-keep-your-sou-george-sand.author: George Sand
try-to-keep-your-sou-george-sand.text: Try to keep your soul young and quivering right up to old age.

we-still-do-not-know-albert-einstein.author: Albert Einstein
we-still-do-not-know-albert-einstein.text: We still do not know one thousandth of one percent of what nature has revealed to us.

i-love-everything-th-oliver-goldsmith.author: Oliver Goldsmith
i-love-everything-th-oliver-goldsmith.text: I love everything that's old, - old friends, old times, old manners, old books, old wine.

if-you-cant-tolerat-jeff-bezos.author: Jeff Bezos
if-you-cant-tolerat-jeff-bezos.text: If you can't tolerate critics, don't do anything new or interesting.

our-hearts-were-drun-george-william-russ.author: George William Russell
our-hearts-were-drun-george-william-russ.text: Our hearts were drunk with a beauty Our eyes could never see.

the-world-is-not-com-martin-buber.author: Martin Buber
the-world-is-not-com-martin-buber.text: The world is not comprehensible, but it is embraceable: through the embracing of one of its beings.

you-gotta-try-your-l-jimmy-dean.author: Jimmy Dean
you-gotta-try-your-l-jimmy-dean.text: You gotta try your luck at least once a day, because you could be going around lucky all day and not even know it.

every-reform-movemen-theodore-roosevelt.author: Theodore Roosevelt
every-reform-movemen-theodore-roosevelt.text: Every reform movement has a lunatic fringe.

better-to-illuminate-thomas-aquinas.author: Thomas Aquinas
better-to-illuminate-thomas-aquinas.text: Better to illuminate than merely to shine, to deliver to others contemplated truths than merely to contemplate.

one-is-loved-because-paulo-coelho.author: Paulo Coelho
one-is-loved-because-paulo-coelho.text: One is loved because one is loved. No reason is needed for loving.

peace-and-justice-ar-dwight-d-eisenhower.author: Dwight D. Eisenhower
peace-and-justice-ar-dwight-d-eisenhower.text: Peace and justice are two sides of the same coin.

you-dont-pay-taxes-chris-rock.author: Chris Rock
you-dont-pay-taxes-chris-rock.text: You don't pay taxes - they take taxes.

dont-stay-in-bed-u-george-burns.author: George Burns
dont-stay-in-bed-u-george-burns.text: Don't stay in bed, unless you can make money in bed.

if-we-knew-each-othe-john-churton-collin.author: John Churton Collins
if-we-knew-each-othe-john-churton-collin.text: If we knew each other's secrets, what comforts we should find.

love-is-all-it-give-soren-kierkegaard.author: Soren Kierkegaard
love-is-all-it-give-soren-kierkegaard.text: Love is all, it gives all, and it takes all.

the-ability-to-simpl-hans-hofmann.author: Hans Hofmann
the-ability-to-simpl-hans-hofmann.text: The ability to simplify means to eliminate the unnecessary so that the necessary may speak.

words-like-nature-alfred-lord-tennyson.author: Alfred Lord Tennyson
words-like-nature-alfred-lord-tennyson.text: Words, like nature, half reveal and half conceal the soul within.

behold-my-friends-sitting-bull.author: Sitting Bull
behold-my-friends-sitting-bull.text: Behold, my friends, the spring is come; the earth has gladly received the embraces of the sun, and we shall soon see the results of their love!

in-youth-we-learn-i-marie-von-ebner-esch.author: Marie von Ebner-Eschenbach
in-youth-we-learn-i-marie-von-ebner-esch.text: In youth we learn; in age we understand.

most-people-have-the-bobby-knight.author: Bobby Knight
most-people-have-the-bobby-knight.text: Most people have the will to win, few have the will to prepare to win.

our-greatest-weaknes-thomas-a-edison.author: Thomas A. Edison
our-greatest-weaknes-thomas-a-edison.text: Our greatest weakness lies in giving up. The most certain way to succeed is always to try just one more time.

remember-democracy-john-adams.author: John Adams
remember-democracy-john-adams.text: Remember, democracy never lasts long. It soon wastes, exhausts, and murders itself. There never was a democracy yet that did not commit suicide.

spring-is-natures-w-robin-williams.author: Robin Williams
spring-is-natures-w-robin-williams.text: Spring is nature's way of saying, 'Let's party!'

talent-hits-a-target-arthur-schopenhauer.author: Arthur Schopenhauer
talent-hits-a-target-arthur-schopenhauer.text: Talent hits a target no one else can hit; Genius hits a target no one else can see.

the-beautiful-spring-harriet-ann-jacobs.author: Harriet Ann Jacobs
the-beautiful-spring-harriet-ann-jacobs.text: The beautiful spring came; and when Nature resumes her loveliness, the human soul is apt to revive also.

the-most-influential-william-temple.author: William Temple
the-most-influential-william-temple.text: The most influential of all educational factors is the conversation in a child's home.

you-always-have-to-r-cyndi-lauper.author: Cyndi Lauper
you-always-have-to-r-cyndi-lauper.text: You always have to remember - no matter what you're told - that God loves all the flowers, even the wild ones that grow on the side of the highway.

you-will-never-find-charles-buxton.author: Charles Buxton
you-will-never-find-charles-buxton.text: You will never find time for anything. If you want time you must make it.

any-time-not-spent-o-torquato-tasso.author: Torquato Tasso
any-time-not-spent-o-torquato-tasso.text: Any time not spent on love is wasted.

expect-to-have-hope-sarah-ban-breathnach.author: Sarah Ban Breathnach
expect-to-have-hope-sarah-ban-breathnach.text: Expect to have hope rekindled. Expect your prayers to be answered in wondrous ways. The dry seasons in life do not last. The spring rains will come again.

from-the-end-spring-pliny-the-elder.author: Pliny the Elder
from-the-end-spring-pliny-the-elder.text: From the end spring new beginnings.

music-comes-from-an-henry-williamson.author: Henry Williamson
music-comes-from-an-henry-williamson.text: Music comes from an icicle as it melts, to live again as spring water.

oaths-are-but-words-samuel-butler.author: Samuel Butler
oaths-are-but-words-samuel-butler.text: Oaths are but words, and words are but wind.

pennies-do-not-come-margaret-thatcher.author: Margaret Thatcher
pennies-do-not-come-margaret-thatcher.text: Pennies do not come from heaven. They have to be earned here on earth.

spring-has-returned-rainer-maria-rilke.author: Rainer Maria Rilke
spring-has-returned-rainer-maria-rilke.text: Spring has returned. The Earth is like a child that knows poems.

the-first-day-of-spr-henry-van-dyke.author: Henry Van Dyke
the-first-day-of-spr-henry-van-dyke.text: The first day of spring is one thing, and the first spring day is another. The difference between them is sometimes as great as a month.

to-hold-a-pen-is-to-voltaire.author: Voltaire
to-hold-a-pen-is-to-voltaire.text: To hold a pen is to be at war.

you-exist-only-in-wh-federico-fellini.author: Federico Fellini
you-exist-only-in-wh-federico-fellini.text: You exist only in what you do.

sadly-its-much-eas-james-lovelock.author: James Lovelock
sadly-its-much-eas-james-lovelock.text: Sadly, it's much easier to create a desert than a forest.

the-day-the-lord-cre-bernard-williams.author: Bernard Williams
the-day-the-lord-cre-bernard-williams.text: The day the Lord created hope was probably the same day he created Spring.

who-has-a-harder-fig-thomas-a-kempis.author: Thomas a Kempis
who-has-a-harder-fig-thomas-a-kempis.text: Who has a harder fight than he who is striving to overcome himself.

you-prove-your-worth-jean-paul.author: Jean Paul
you-prove-your-worth-jean-paul.text: You prove your worth with your actions, not with your mouth.

a-drawing-is-simply-paul-klee.author: Paul Klee
a-drawing-is-simply-paul-klee.text: A drawing is simply a line going for a walk.

art-in-itself-is-a-stephen-sondheim.author: Stephen Sondheim
art-in-itself-is-a-stephen-sondheim.text: Art, in itself, is an attempt to bring order out of chaos.

chase-after-the-trut-clarence-darrow.author: Clarence Darrow
chase-after-the-trut-clarence-darrow.text: Chase after the truth like all hell and you'll free yourself, even though you never touch its coat tails.

everybody-wants-to-t-mike-krzyzewski.author: Mike Krzyzewski
everybody-wants-to-t-mike-krzyzewski.text: Everybody wants to take responsibility when you win, but when you fail, all these fingers are pointing.

everyone-can-identif-thomas-kinkade.author: Thomas Kinkade
everyone-can-identif-thomas-kinkade.text: Everyone can identify with a fragrant garden, with beauty of sunset, with the quiet of nature, with a warm and cozy cottage.

if-you-do-not-conque-napoleon-hill.author: Napoleon Hill
if-you-do-not-conque-napoleon-hill.text: If you do not conquer self, you will be conquered by self.

in-fair-weather-prep-thomas-fuller.author: Thomas Fuller
in-fair-weather-prep-thomas-fuller.text: In fair weather prepare for foul.

in-general-pride-is-john-ruskin.author: John Ruskin
in-general-pride-is-john-ruskin.text: In general, pride is at the bottom of all great mistakes.

just-because-everyth-irene-peter.author: Irene Peter
just-because-everyth-irene-peter.text: Just because everything is different doesn't mean anything has changed.

now-this-is-not-the-winston-churchill.author: Winston Churchill
now-this-is-not-the-winston-churchill.text: Now this is not the end. It is not even the beginning of the end. But it is, perhaps, the end of the beginning.

sometimes-the-truth-henry-rollins.author: Henry Rollins
sometimes-the-truth-henry-rollins.text: Sometimes the truth hurts. And sometimes it feels real good.

success-is-the-sum-o-robert-collier.author: Robert Collier
success-is-the-sum-o-robert-collier.text: Success is the sum of small efforts - repeated day in and day out.

the-japanese-say-if-lester-cole.author: Lester Cole
the-japanese-say-if-lester-cole.text: The Japanese say, If the flower is to be beautiful, it must be cultivated.

the-man-who-is-swimm-woodrow-wilson.author: Woodrow Wilson
the-man-who-is-swimm-woodrow-wilson.text: The man who is swimming against the stream knows the strength of it.

there-is-a-fellowshi-robert-louis-steven.author: Robert Louis Stevenson
there-is-a-fellowshi-robert-louis-steven.text: There is a fellowship more quiet even than solitude, and which, rightly understood, is solitude made perfect.

there-is-nothing-lik-victor-hugo.author: Victor Hugo
there-is-nothing-lik-victor-hugo.text: There is nothing like a dream to create the future.

to-love-for-the-sake-alphonse-de-lamarti.author: Alphonse de Lamartine
to-love-for-the-sake-alphonse-de-lamarti.text: To love for the sake of being loved is human, but to love for the sake of loving is angelic.

were-all-victims-of-kevin-spacey.author: Kevin Spacey
were-all-victims-of-kevin-spacey.text: We're all victims of our own hubris at times.

you-reclaim-your-pow-bryant-h-mc-gill.author: Bryant H. McGill
you-reclaim-your-pow-bryant-h-mc-gill.text: You reclaim your power by loving what you were once taught to hate.

dont-cry-because-it-dr-seuss.author: Dr. Seuss
dont-cry-because-it-dr-seuss.text: Don't cry because it's over. Smile because it happened.

everything-has-its-w-helen-keller.author: Helen Keller
everything-has-its-w-helen-keller.text: Everything has its wonders, even darkness and silence, and I learn, whatever state I may be in, therein to be content.

holding-on-to-anger-buddha.author: Buddha
holding-on-to-anger-buddha.text: Holding on to anger is like grasping a hot coal with the intent of throwing it at someone else; you are the one who gets burned.

justice-sir-is-the-daniel-webster.author: Daniel Webster
justice-sir-is-the-daniel-webster.text: Justice, sir, is the great interest of man on earth. It is the ligament which holds civilized beings and civilized nations together.

never-forget-the-thr-h-jackson-brown-jr.author: H. Jackson Brown, Jr.
never-forget-the-thr-h-jackson-brown-jr.text: Never forget the three powerful resources you always have available to you: love, prayer, and forgiveness.

the-truth-does-not-c-flannery-o-connor.author: Flannery O'Connor
the-truth-does-not-c-flannery-o-connor.text: The truth does not change according to our ability to stomach it.

whats-right-isnt-a-howard-cosell.author: Howard Cosell
whats-right-isnt-a-howard-cosell.text: What's right isn't always popular. What's popular isn't always right.
